titles.title: California Trail Interpretive Center Act

To establish the California Trail Interpretive Center in Elko, Nevada, to facilitate the interpretation of the history of development and use of trails in the settling of the western portion of the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 6/21/2000--Introduced. California Trail Interpretive Center Act - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to establish the California Trail Interpretive Center for the purpose of interpreting the history of development and use of the California Trail in the settling of the West.Instructs the Secretary to: (1) prepare a development plan according to prescribed guidelines; and (2) consider the findings of a certain master plan study for such Center.Authorizes appropriations.
